page.title: 03LUNAN, EDUCATION, SOCIAL.
page.content: This area has no centre of population sufficiently concentrated to be self- sufficient for cultural activities. There has never been a village hall and the elementary school, which could have been used for meetings was closed in 1953 and is now a dwelling house. The primary school pupils go to either Ferryden or Inverkeilor schools whilst those of secondary school age attend either Montrose or Arbroath Academies. It is also to these areas that the population turn to for social activities, for example, clubs for senior citizens, women, men, and the young people can be found at Inverkeilor, whilst bridge clubs, bingo, theatre and the cinema can be found at the larger towns. The hotel does not serve the area as a local public house.
